catalog_info.title: Vertebrate Evolution
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: OEB 53 or with permission of instructor. Life Sciences 2 recommended. Lab component: T, Th, 2:30pm-4:00pm for Spring 2016
catalog_info.description: This course provides a comprehensive survey of the origin and evolution of vertebrates through an examination of the fossil record. A primary focus will be on major events in Earth’s evolutionary history, with an emphasis on anatomical and physiological transformations in fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds and mammals.
